alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 11:35AM EDT until August 06 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Kentucky, Pulaski and Rockcastle. In southeast Kentucky, Jackson. * WHEN...Until 230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1135 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Vernon, Boone, Muellersville, Renfro Valley, Hummel, Wildie, Lake Linville, Orlando, Roundstone, Burr, Flat Rock, Dudley Station, Hiatt, Bummer, Wellhope, Pine Hill, Maretburg, Conway, Sinks and Withers. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
